data.title: 22 - İlkay Gündoğan

data.text:
I don't think the club would ever buy him this summer and incorporate him to the club immediately. Would make little sense when you can have him play at Dortmund. CL won't be a problem as Dortmund won't reach the CL next season.

Personally I would make a deal with Gundogan and his inner circle (agent etc.) about us buying him in January. It would mean that we would have 4 further months to evaluate him.

Imagine if we buy him this summer and he gets seriously injured in October or November? Then we would basically incorporate an injured player.

In my eyes we should use the "ter Stegen" model as I call it.

He will never accept that.

IIRC but Ryu will have to confirm, he said in interviews he won't try to screw Dortmund over a transfer.

He won't leave for free.

[MENTION=16262]Ryu Hayabusa[/MENTION]

Dortmund just wouldn't play him. They are bringing in Geis as his replacement and he will play in midfield with sahin or bender. Gundogan might get the odd game here or there but it would be bad for his development and he would suffer greatly not playing.

That's not certain. Gundogan is open to stay at Dortmund until his contract expires and Dortmund would win nothing by not using him. A player like him is almost always useful for a team regardless of him leaving in a few months. Especially in a transition period with a new manager, new players etc.

Look at Lewandowski. Dortmund used him as much as any other play despite them knowing that he would leave for free for Bayern the following season. The preferred to use him instead of letting him rot on the bench. The only right thing to do unless you are a child managing a club.

Even if he stayed and played little he would still have played more than if we incorporated him this summer. Why? Because we simply can't register him. His only games will be training games at our training pitch.

I am not sure if this is a possibility but we could also buy him from Dortmund this summer and loan him out to a 3 party. That would probably be quite complicated and not very realistic.

In any case we will see what will happen and whether we will buy him to begin with. Something tells me that we will.

He will never accept that.

He won't leave for free.

[MENTION=16262]Ryu Hayabusa[/MENTION]

I read that he was open to stay at Dortmund until the next summer and run his contract down if that was what Dortmund would want to do. I can't see that happening either but it's not important in this case as we won't have a problem with buying him this summer or in January 2016.

Dortmund gets a new staff.

I'm not sure they will say no to easy money this summer. Especially since IIRC, Gundogan would want Dortmund to get a good enough fee for him if they decide to sell him.

I can see him being sold 30M.

If Dybala is worth 35M with bonus included (even more since Palerme will probably get players like Coman in the deal), Gundogan is worth at least 30M.

Now of course he can be sold for 22M+8M bonus or in installments.

As I said, we need [MENTION=16262]Ryu Hayabusa[/MENTION] here. He knows the german news better than all of us and can say which ones are BS or not.

well, I'm a firm believer in Gundogan.

Followed him during that incredible season when Dortmund reached the CL final. And I don't believe he lost his talent because of an injury, even if it was a long injury.

He still has the potential to be amongs the top 5 midfielders in the world.

Thinking about it I am not so sure anymore that we need to buy 2 midfielders this season. Regardless of Xavi leaving.

Might as well stick with Gundogan and then strengthen other positions this summer or in January 2016.

A "marquee" midfield signing could always be done next summer. For instance buying Pogba or some other midfielder.

Let's wait and see and hope for the best. Exciting times ahead of us for sure.

Im of a strong opinion it won't however. Dortmund would have received the transfer fee ( be it 20 million or 40 million) and would play Geis who is the future and some even consider him a superior player at this moment in time. I think the way the dortmund board think has changed since the lewa and gotze sale. Watzke and Zorc seem a little more ruthless and i wouldn't put it beyond them to freeze gundogan out. Just a hunch.
